CELG.O,UPDATE 2-Celgene raises 2017 revenue, profit forecast; maintains 2020 view Jan 9 Celgene Corp on Monday raised its 2017 revenue and profit forecasts on the strength of its flagship Revlimid multiple myeloma drug and increased expectations for other treatments for cancer and psoriasis. ~

C,LATAM CLOSE-One issuer raises US$ in LatAm primary market NEW YORK, Jan 9 (IFR) - Below is a recap of primary issuance activity in the LatAm primary market on Monday: ~DTCC to rebuild credit default swaps processing platform with blockchain NEW YORK Post-trade provider the Depository Trust & Clearing Corporation (DTCC) will use blockchain technology this year to rebuild its platform that processes $11 trillion worth of credit default swaps, as Wall Street intensifies efforts to take advantage of the emerging technology. ~DTCC to rebuild credit default swaps processing platform with blockchain NEW YORK, Jan 9 Post-trade provider the Depository Trust & Clearing Corporation (DTCC) will use blockchain technology this year to rebuild its platform that processes $11 trillion worth of credit default swaps, as Wall Street intensifies efforts to take advantage of the emerging technology. ~

ETR,UPDATE 3-New York City's closest nuclear power plant to shut by 2021 Jan 9 Entergy Corp's over 40-year old Indian Point nuclear power plant will be shut by 2021 because of concerns for the safety of  millions of New Yorkers in and around the Big Apple, Governor Andrew Cuomo announced on Monday. ~NY State to shut Indian Point nuclear plant - Gov Cuomo Entergy Corp's Indian Point nuclear power plant in New York state will shut down by April 2021, Governor Andrew Cuomo announced on Monday, due primarily to its proximity to the heavily populated New York City area. ~NY State to shut Indian Point nuclear plant -Gov Cuomo Jan 9 The Indian Point nuclear plant will shut down by April 2021, New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced on Monday, under an agreement the state reached with Entergy Corp . ~BRIEF-Entergy, NY officials agree on Indian point closure in 2020-2021 * Entergy, ny officials agree on indian point closure in 2020-2021 ~
F,Fiat Chrysler may end Mexico output if Trump tariff too high-CEO DETROIT, Jan 9 Fiat Chrysler Automobiles   Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne said on Monday that if tariffs set in a Trump administration on vehicles made in Mexico and imported to the United States are too high, the company may end Mexican production. ~UPDATE 2-Trump praises Ford, Fiat Chrysler for U.S. investments DETROIT, Jan 9 President-elect Donald Trump praised Ford Motor Co and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV  on Monday for announcing new investments in the United States after he made U.S. auto production a key part of his campaign. ~Ford says Bronco SUV, Ranger midsize pickup truck to return in U.S. DETROIT Ford Motor Co  will return to its U.S. model lineup the Bronco, a truck-like SUV, and the midsize pickup truck Ranger, the company said on Monday at the Detroit auto show. ~Ford says Bronco SUV, Ranger midsize pickup truck to return in U.S. DETROIT, Jan 9 Ford Motor Co will return to its U.S. model lineup the Bronco, a truck-like SUV, and the midsize pickup truck Ranger, the company said on Monday at the Detroit auto show. ~Trump praises Ford, Fiat for U.S. investments WASHINGTON, Jan 9 President-elect Donald Trump praised Ford Motor Co and Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV for announcing new investments in the United States after he made U.S. auto production a key part of his campaign. ~

GS,UPDATE 1-Goldman names Elisha Wiesel as new chief information officer Jan 9 Goldman Sachs Group Inc has named a new chief information officer as former head Marty Chavez will become chief financial officer of the Wall Street firm. ~Goldman names Elisha Wiesel as new chief information officer, replacing Chavez Jan 9 Goldman Sachs Group Inc has named a new chief information officer as former head Marty Chavez moves on to become CFO of the Wall Street firm. ~US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St opens lower as energy stocks, Goldman weigh Jan 9 U.S. stocks opened lower on Monday as energy stocks were pulled down by a drop in oil prices, while a decline in Goldman Sachs moved the Dow Jones Industrial Average further from the historic 20,000 mark. ~
JPM,JPMorgan's Dimon says strong economy will speed interest rate hikes SAN FRANCISCO, Jan 9 Strength in the United States economy will drive interest rate hikes more quickly than many people expect, JPMorgan Chase & Co CEO Jamie Dimon said on Monday. ~UPDATE 1-Bitcoin exchange operator pleads guilty in U.S. case tied to JPMorgan hack NEW YORK, Jan 9 A Florida man pleaded guilty on Monday to charges that he conspired to operate an illegal bitcoin exchange, which prosecutors said was owned by an Israeli who oversaw a massive scheme to hack companies, including JPMorgan Chase & Co. ~Indonesia bars JPMorgan from next dollar sukuk issuance: official JAKARTA Indonesia has barred U.S. bank JPMorgan Chase & Co  from submitting an underwriting proposal for its next issuance of dollar-denominated Islamic bonds, a finance ministry official said on Monday. ~UPDATE 2-Indonesia bars JPMorgan from next dollar sukuk issuance - official * Indonesia has asked other banks to submit proposal for USD sukuk ~
KSS,Canadian retailer Hudson's Bay cuts revenue forecast Jan 9 Hudson's Bay Co, the owner of U.S. luxury retail chain Saks Fifth Avenue, cut its full-year revenue forecast for the second time, citing a challenging retail environment in the United States and Europe. ~

MDLZ.O,UPDATE 3-Mars to buy pet healthcare provider VCA for $7.7 bln Jan 9 Candy and pet food conglomerate Mars Inc is buying veterinary hospital operator VCA Inc for $7.7 billion in a deal that will give the maker of Pedigree pet food an even bigger share of the $4 billion global pet healthcare market. ~REFILE-Mondelez in $13 mln SEC settlement tied to India payments Jan 9 Mondelez International Inc agreed to pay $13 million to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges that its Cadbury unit violated a federal anti-bribery law through efforts to expand a chocolate plant in Baddi, India. ~
MS,Morgan Stanley commodities executive Hart, who helped build physical business, retires Jan 9 Morgan Stanley executive Debbie Hart, who helped to grow the bank's physical commodities businesses, has retired from the bank, a spokesman confirmed on Monday. ~McDonald's sells most of China, HK business to CITIC, Carlyle for $2.1 billion HONG KONG McDonald's Corp  has agreed to sell the bulk of its China and Hong Kong business to state-backed conglomerate CITIC Ltd  and Carlyle Group LP  for up to $2.1 billion, seeking to expand rapidly without using much of its own capital. | Video  ~UPDATE 3-Morgan Stanley, UBS to raise stakes in China securities JVs to 49 pct-sources * Morgan Stanley awaiting regulator's approval for stake hike ~Morgan Stanley plans to raise China securities JV stake to 49 pct - sources HONG KONG, Jan 9 Morgan Stanley plans to raise its stake in its Chinese securities joint venture to 49 percent from about 33 percent, people with direct knowledge of the development said on Monday. ~

UNH,UPDATE 2-UnitedHealth to buy Surgical Care Affiliates in $2.3 bln deal Jan 9 UnitedHealth Group Inc's said it would buy Surgical Care Affiliates Inc for about $2.30 billion, adding heft to its business that provides services including primary and urgent care in ambulances. ~BRIEF-Surgical care affiliates Optumcare to combine * Surgical Care Affiliates Inc - acquisition to be funded between 51 percent and 80 percent with UnitedHealth Group common stock ~UnitedHealth to buy Surgical Care Affiliates in $2.3 bln deal Jan 9 UnitedHealth Group Inc said on Monday its Optum unit  would buy Surgical Care Affiliates Inc  in a deal  valuing the company at about $2.3 billion. ~
VRTX.O,Vertex Pharmaceuticals revenue outlook for cystic fibrosis treatments Jan 8 Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc said on Sunday that it expected full-year 2017 revenue from its Orkambi cystic fibrosis treatment of $1.1 billion to $1.3 billion and revenue from its Kalydeco treatment of $690 million to $710 million. ~
